btop.description: A better top command. It is a task manager.

neofetch.description: A command line system information tool. It displays information about your system next to an image, your operating system logo, or any ASCII file of your choice.

ncdu.description: A disk usage analyzer with an ncurses interface.

fdupes.description: A program for identifying or deleting duplicate files residing within specified directories.

df.description: A command-line utility for reporting file system disk space usage.

zoxide.description: A faster way to navigate your filesystem. It acts as replacement for cd command.

eza.description: A simple and fast command-line file manager. It is a replacement for ls command.

fzf.description: A command-line fuzzy finder. It is used to search and open files. It is AMAZING once setup properly with key bindings and previews.

bat.description: A cat clone with wings. It is used to display file contents with syntax highlighting.

wget.description: A command-line utility for downloading files from the web.

procs.description: A modern replacement for ps written in Rust.

rip.description: You use rip instead of rm. You can recover files deleted by rip. Although later you can permanent delete too.

gping.description: A ping tool with a graph.

cmus.description: A small, fast and powerful console music player for Unix-like operating systems.

hexdump.description: A command-line utility that displays the contents of a file in hexadecimal, decimal, octal, or ASCII format.

objdump.description: Display information from object files. Mainly wanna use this for binary files like `objdump -d <file>`

file.description: Determine file type and more information which is a must when reverse engineering binary files.

exiftool.description: Read meta information in files. It is very handy.

chmod.description: Change file permissions. You can use chmod +x <file> to make it executable.

strings.description: Print the strings of printable characters in files. It is very useful for reverse engineering.
